action.action-desc: Mr. McGovern (for himself, Mr. Neal, and Mr. Welch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study of the Deerfield River for potential addition to the national wild and scenic rivers system, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Deerfield River Wild and Scenic River Study Act of 2022.
Section 5 of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act (16 U.S.C. 1276) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: the North, South, East, and West Branches of the Deerfield River; and
the major tributaries of the Deerfield River, including the Green River, North River, South River, Clesson Brook, Chickley River, Cold River, Gulf Brook, Bog Brook, and Dunbar Brook.

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by adding at the end the following:
Not later than 3 years after the date on which funds are made available to carry out this paragraph, the Secretary of the Interior shall—

subparagraph.text: complete the study described in subsection (a)(145); and
submit to the appropriate committees of Congress a report describing the results of such study.
